newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Copper to face resistance, seen lower.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Copper to face resistance, seen lower.

text.p: 3 MONTH CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
Copper faces resistance above $2,500 a tonne after Monday's downside correction and is vulnerable to test support around $2,465, traders and chart-watchers said on Tuesday.
Aluminium after an upside chart close on Monday may probe higher levels, though market operators will closely monitor the movements of copper.
COPPER - The technical picture has been damaged by the downside move on Monday and prices could now move towards support at $2,460/65 a tonne, analysts said.

"With the technical indicators crossing down out of the overbought region in line with the market's downward break look for further underlying tests of support below $2,500," Martin Squires of LME brokers Rudolf Wolff said. Squires pegged his initial downside target at $2,460.
Harry Creates of Amalgamated Metal Trading (AMT) said if $2,485 fails to hold falls to $2,461 and $2,445 could be seen.
On the upside first resistance is expected at $2,525.
"On the upside a close above $2,535 is needed to relieve downward pressure and target the April uptrend at $2,550," Creates said.
At 0700 GMT three months LME copper was quoted at $2,508/13, little changed from Monday's late London close of $2,509/12.

ALUMINIUM - An upside chart close on Monday could see prices move towards resistance at $1,600 a tonne, though any aggressive downside moves in copper could easily dent sentiment, traders and analysts said.
"A positive close on the chart, with the appearance of a bullish engulfing pattern suggesting a move higher," LME brokers Brandies said.
"The technical indicators have picked up as we look to strike higher to target $1,600/10 resistance," Squires of Rudolf Wolff said.
On the downside support is expected at $1,575 and a fanline around $1,568.
At 0700 GMT three months aluminium was quoted at $1,587/90, versus $1,588/90.
